title: Waverley; Or, 'Tis Sixty Years Since
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: A jolly dame, who, not 'Sixty Years since,' kept the principalcaravansary at Greenlaw in Berwickshire, had the honour to receiveunder her roof a very worthy clergyman, with three sons of the sameprofession, each having a cure of souls: be it said in passing, none ofthe reverend party were reckoned powerful in the pulpit. After dinnerwas over, the worthy senior, in the pride of his heart, asked Mrs.Buchan whether she ever had had such a party in her house before.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 20

title: Romance of War ... New edition
author: Grant, James
snippet: ' Oh, monsieur ! not even the pledge of my most sacred honour as agentleman and soldier could bind me while love and ambition filled myheart. I mourned the monotonous life of a military prisoner, and fledfrom the depot at Greenlaw ; but I was retaken a day after, and sent tothis strong fortress, where for three long and weary years I have beenconfined among the common file. Oh, monsieur ! Diane—my mother—my sisters ! what sad changes may not have happened among themin that time !'
